robox.startFinch: This block is required for every Finch program. Put it in the on start block.
robox.setMove: Moves the Finch forward or back for a given distance at a given speed (0-100%).
robox.setTurn: Turns the Finch right or left a given angle at a given speed (0-100%).
robox.setBeak: Sets the tri-color LED in the Finch beak to the color specified by red, green, and blue brightness values. The values range from 0% to 100%.
robox.setTail: Sets one or all of the tri-color LEDs in the Finch tail to the color specified by red, green, and blue brightness values. The values range from 0% to 100%.
robox.startMotors: Sets the rotation speeds of the left and right Finch wheels to values from -100 to 100%.
robox.getDistance: Returns the value of the Finch distance sensor in cm.
robox.getLight: Returns the value of the right or left Finch light sensor from 0 to 100.
robox.getLine: Returns the value of the right or left Finch line tracking sensor from 0 to 100.
robox.getEncoder: Returns the number of rotations that the right or left wheel has turned.
robox.resetEncoders: Sets the value of the left and right encoders to zero.
robox.getFinchOrientation: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether or not the Finch is in the selected position.
robox.getFinchAM: Returns the value of the Finch accelerometer or magnetometer in the x, y, or z direction.
robox.getFinchCompass: Returns the value of the Finch compass in degrees.
robox.getBattery: Reads the value of the battery in milliVolts. You may start to see strange behavior when the value is below 3373 mV.
